Rob Peal |formerchoreographer= |skating club= Skokie Valley Skating Club |former skating club= |currenttraininglocations = [[Lake Arrowhead, California]]
[[Northbrook, Illinois]] |formertraininglocations = |beganskating = 1999 |retired= |worldranking= '''43''' (''{{As of|2011|6|16}}'') |pbrankings = '''49''' (''[[2010â2011 figure skating season|2010â2011]]'') |combined total= 197.23 |combined date= [[2011â2012 ISU Junior Grand Prix|2011 JGP Australia]] |SP score= 68.20 |SP date= 2011 JGP Australia |FS score= 129.03 |FS date= 2011 JGP Australia }} '''Jason Brown''' (born December 15, 1994 in [[Los Angeles]]) is an [[United States of America|American]] [[Figure skating|figure skater]]. He is the 2010 [[2010 United States Figure Skating Championships|U.S. Junior champion]]. == Career == Brown began skating at age three-and-half, his mother having signed up his sister and him to Learn to Skate classes. He has been coached by Kori Ade since the age of five, and trains in various rinks in the Chicago area. Most of his programs have been choreographed by Rohene Ward. Brown also skated [[pair skating|pairs]] with Thea Milburn for three years. At 11, Brown won the national juvenile title. He won the bronze medal at the 2009 [[2009 United States Figure Skating Championships|U.S. Novice Championships]]. During the 2009â10 season, he won the [[2010 United States Figure Skating Championships|U.S. junior title]], after placing second in the short program, 0.07 behind the leader, and in the long program. During the [[2010â2011 figure skating season|2010â11 season]], Brown began competing internationally at the junior level. He won the silver medal at the [[2010â2011 ISU Junior Grand Prix|Junior Grand Prix]] in France and placed 6th in his second JGP event in Japan. He finished 9th in his senior national debut at the [[2011 United States Figure Skating Championships|2011 U.S. Championships]] with an impressive performance despite not attempting a triple axel, which he had decided to put off due to a growth spurt. He was assigned to compete at the [[2011 World Junior Figure Skating Championships|World Junior Championships]] where he finished 7th. Brown worked on the triple axel for the following season, while adapting to another growth spurt. He stopped wearing hinge boots. Brown began the [[2011â2012 figure skating season|2011â12 season]] by winning his first [[2011â12 ISU Junior Grand Prix|Junior Grand Prix]] event in [[Brisbane]], Australia. == Personal life == Jason Brown's mother is a television producer and his father works for a lighting company. He has an older sister, Jordan, and a younger brother, Dylan. He is Jewish and had a [[Bar Mitzvah]]. He goes to Highland Park High School and received the Ralph Potter Memorial award for Exceptional Ability and Achievement and the President's Education Award for Outstanding Academic Excellence. == Programs == {|class=wikitable style=text-align:center !
